intro: Calendula montserratensis, commonly known as the Montserrat marigold, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Montserrat. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and its flowering stems are usually unbranched. Calendula montserratensis is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
